p: The H. curassavicum EOs of the coastal and inland samples showed a significant scavenging activity of both 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) and 2,2’-azino-bis(3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulphonic acid (ABTS) in a concentration-dependent manner ( Table 4). The IC 50 value of the EO from the coastal sample was 30.78 and 22.70 mg mL −1 for DPPH and ABTS, respectively, while the inland sample showed IC 50 values of 40.40 and 29.92 mg mL −1. On the other hand, the MeOH extract of H. curassavicum revealed comparable antioxidant activity to the EO activity ( Table 4), where the coastal and inland MeOH extracts attained IC 50 values of 27.51 and 36.57 mg mL −1, respectively, of DPPH scavenging and 23.12 and 27.41 mg mL −1 of ABTS scavenging.
